verses.verse: He cried<WH7121> also in mine ears<WH241> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>, saying<WH559>, Cause them that have charge<WH6486> over the city<WH5892> to draw near<WH7126>, even every man<WH376> with his destroying<WH4892> weapon<WH3627> in his hand<WH3027>.

And, behold, six<WH8337> men<WH582> came<WH935> from the way<WH1870> of the higher<WH5945> gate<WH8179>, which lieth<WH6437> toward the north<WH6828>, and every man<WH376> a slaughter<WH4660> weapon<WH3627> in his hand<WH3027>; and one<WH259> man<WH376> among<WH8432> them was clothed<WH3847> with linen<WH906>, with a writer's<WH5608> inkhorn<WH7083> by his side<WH4975>: and they went in<WH935>, and stood<WH5975> beside<WH681> the brasen<WH5178> altar<WH4196>.

And the glory<WH3519> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> was gone up<WH5927> from the cherub<WH3742>, whereupon he was, to the threshold<WH4670> of the house<WH1004>. And he called<WH7121> to the man<WH376> clothed<WH3847> with linen<WH906>, which had the writer's<WH5608> inkhorn<WH7083> by his side<WH4975>;

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto him, Go through<WH5674> the midst<WH8432> of the city<WH5892>, through the midst<WH8432> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, and set<WH8427> a mark<WH8420> upon the foreheads<WH4696> of the men<WH582> that sigh<WH584> and that cry<WH602> for all the abominations<WH8441> that be done<WH6213> in the midst<WH8432> thereof.

¶ And to the others<WH428> he said<WH559> in mine hearing<WH241>, Go<WH5674> ye after<WH310> him through the city<WH5892>, and smite<WH5221>: let not your eye<WH5869> spare<WH2347>, neither have ye pity<WH2550>:

Slay<WH2026> utterly<WH4889> old<WH2205> and young<WH970>, both maids<WH1330>, and little children<WH2945>, and women<WH802>: but come not near<WH5066> any man<WH376> upon whom is the mark<WH8420>; and begin<WH2490> at my sanctuary<WH4720>. Then they began<WH2490> at the ancient<WH2205> men<WH582> which were before<WH6440> the house<WH1004>.

And he said<WH559> unto them, Defile<WH2930> the house<WH1004>, and fill<WH4390> the courts<WH2691> with the slain<WH2491>: go ye forth<WH3318>. And they went forth<WH3318>, and slew<WH5221> in the city<WH5892>.

¶ And it came to pass, while they were slaying<WH5221> them, and I was left<WH7604>, that I fell<WH5307> upon my face<WH6440>, and cried<WH2199>, and said<WH559>, Ah<WH162> Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>! wilt thou destroy<WH7843> all the residue<WH7611> of Israel<WH3478> in thy pouring out<WH8210> of thy fury<WH2534> upon Jerusalem<WH3389>?

Then said<WH559> he unto me, The iniquity<WH5771> of the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> and Judah<WH3063> is exceeding<WH3966><WH3966> great<WH1419>, and the land<WH776> is full<WH4390> of blood<WH1818>, and the city<WH5892> full<WH4390> of perverseness<WH4297>: for they say<WH559>, The LORD<WH3068> hath forsaken<WH5800> the earth<WH776>, and the LORD<WH3068> seeth<WH7200> not.
And as for me also, mine eye<WH5869> shall not spare<WH2347>, neither will I have pity<WH2550>, but I will recompense<WH5414> their way<WH1870> upon their head<WH7218>.

And, behold, the man<WH376> clothed<WH3847> with linen<WH906>, which had the inkhorn<WH7083> by his side<WH4975>, reported<WH7725> the matter<WH1697>, saying<WH559>, I have done<WH6213> as thou hast commanded<WH6680> me.
